item.title: Nikki add a quote by Stella Gibbons
item.description:
". . . And she said it was a pity, because my father was so “keen”, and what did I care about?
So I said, well, I was not quite sure, but on the whole I thought I liked having everything very tidy and calm all around me, and not being bothered to do things, and laughing at the kind of joke other people didn’t think at all funny, and going for country walks, and not being asked to express opinions about things (like love, and isn’t so-and-so peculiar?). So then she said, oh, well, didn’t I think I could try to be a little less slack, because of Father, and I said no, I was I afraid I couldn’t; and after that she left me alone. But all the others still said I was no good." -- Stella Gibbons

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "To a great mind, nothing is little,' remarked Holmes, sententiously." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Let other pens dwell on guilt and misery." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikki add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I can detach myself from the world. If there is a better world to detach oneself from than the one functioning at the moment I have yet to hear of it." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Stella Gibbons
item.description: "Nature is all very well in her place, but she must not be allowed to make things untidy." -- Stella Gibbons

item.title: Nikki add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "A certain critic -- for such men, I regret to say, do exist -- made the nasty remark about my last novel that it contained 'all the old Wodehouse characters under different names.' He has probably by now been eaten by bears, like the children who made mock of the prophet Elisha: but if he still survives he will not be able to make a similar charge against Summer Lightning. With my superior intelligence, I have out-generalled the man this time by putting in all the old Wodehouse characters under the same names. Pretty silly it will make him feel, I rather fancy." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Stella Gibbons
item.description: "The education bestowed on Flora Poste by her parents had been expensive, athletic and prolonged; and when they died within a few weeks of one another during the annual epidemic of the influenza or Spanish Plague which occurred in her twentieth year, she was discovered to possess every art and grace save that of earning her own living." -- Stella Gibbons

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Vannessagrace
item.description:
"<i>"One cannot be a mother without first being a person; family, husband, and children should not be allowed, as is so often the case, to steal a woman’s selfhood and her dreams."<i>
Mother to Sherlock, Mycroft, and Enola Holmes by author Nancy Springer" -- Vannessagrace
